title: Love Island's Dr Alex says he was fifth member of X Factor group but got axed as he couldn't sing
text:
Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Love Island star Dr Alex George has joked he was the fifth member of Celebrity X Factor group The Islanders, but was axed because he couldn't sing.

The medic, who starred in the 2018 show, had been lined to perform alongside his co-stars Samira Mighty , Wes Nelson , Eyal Booker and Zara McDermott .

However, Alex laughed that he didn't stand a chance as he couldn't hit the right notes.

In a post on Instagram , Alex shared a snap of himself posing with his pal Samira and revealed he was nearly part of their pop stardom dream.

He wrote: "I am SO proud of Samira and the others going on The X Factor...

"I was going to be the fifth member of the group but apparently you do have to be able to sing."

(Image: dralexgeorge/Instagram)

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

Alex went on to chat with X factor star Samira for his YouTube channel and she revealed she had previously auditioned for the show when she was a kid.

She explained: "I auditioned for the show when I was 15...

"I waited 15 hours in the queue, with no food, and I got through first two rounds and didn't get through the rest and I was crushed - I was 15."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: PA)

Samira made her X Factor debut last night and her group got lukewarm reviews from the judges.

She added of the group: "We all we wanted to sing and what an amazing opportunity to sing with your friends.

"Everyone can sing and we have a bond that not other contestants might have."

description: Alex George joked he was lined up as a member of X Factor Celebrity group The Islanders but lost his place over his lack of singing ability
